FuncDef:
The service volume-quota apply command specifies the traffic direction to which the EDSG service quota applies.
The undo service volume-quota apply command restores the default traffic direction to which the EDSG service quota applies.
By default, the EDSG service quota applies to both upstream and downstream traffic.
CLIs: undo service volume-quota apply [ inbound | outbound ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the upstream EDSG service traffic.
-

Indicates the downstream EDSG service traffic.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Carriers can carry out prepaid services for the upstream traffic, downstream traffic, or both upstream and downstream traffic. To specify the traffic direction to which the EDSG service quota applies, run the service volume-quota apply command.
Implementation Procedure
If the service volume-quota apply command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one. Therefore, this command configuration takes effect for subsequent login users.
Configuration Impact
After this command is run, if the EDSG service quota is reduced, the reduced quota applies to the specified traffic direction but not to both upstream and downstream directions.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
